{{also|Wann|ƿann}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|wanne}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*hwannē}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|when}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/van/}} * {{audio|de|LL-Q188 (deu)-Lucas Werkmeister-wann.wav|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|an}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # {{lb|de|interrogative|standard}} [[when]] #: {{ux|de|'''Wann''' kommt er?|'''When''' will he arrive?}} #: {{ux|de|Ich weiß nicht, '''wann''' er kommt.|I don’t know '''when''' he’ll arrive.}} # {{lb|de|indefinite|colloquial}} [[sometime]] #: {{ux|de|Das sollten wir mal '''wann''' besprechen, wenn alle da sind.|We should discuss this '''sometime''' that everybody’s present.}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|sometime}} {{l|de|irgendwann}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|dann und wann}} * {{l|de|wann anders}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|de|conjunction}} # {{lb|de|archaic|or|dialectal}} [[when]]; [[if]] ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|wann immer}} {{i|standard}} ===See also=== * {{l|de|wenn}} ---- ==Low German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|nds|gml|wan}}, from {{inh|nds|osx|hwan||when}}, from {{inh|nds|gem-pro|*hwan||when}}. Related to {{m|nds|wannehr}} and {{m|nds|wenn}}, {{cog|nl|wanneer}} and {{m|nl|wen}}, High {{cog|de|wann}} and {{m|de|wenn}}, {{cog|en|when}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nds|/ʋɑn/|/ʋan/}} * {{IPA|nds|/wanː/}} {{a|conservative Eastalbian}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|nds|conjunction}} # [[when]] (''[[wannehr]]'' is sometimes used with this meaning as well) #: {{ux|nds|Ik weet nich, wann he kamen deit.|I don't know when he'll come.}} ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|lb|goh|wanne}}, from {{inh|lb|gem-pro|*hwannē}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/vɑn/}} * {{rhymes|lb|ɑn}} * {{homophones|lb|Wann}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|lb|conjunction}} # [[if]] #* [http://www.cathol.lu/spip.php?page=article&id_article=1588&psn_f=contexte&psn_livre=Mt&psn_cvgr=004006&psn_d=4fd817351b8876a78b651ebe212bdc5e Luxembourgish translation of Matthew 4:6]: #*: {{quote|lb|Hie sot zu him: "'''Wann''' s du dem Herrgott säi Jong bass, da gehei dech hei erof! Et steet nämlech geschriwwen: Wéinst denger gëtt hien sengen Engelen den Uerder, an si droen dech op den Hänn, fir datt s du dir de Fouss net un engem Stee stéiss."|He said to him: "'''If''' you are the Son of God, then throw yourself down! For it is written: He will give his angels charge concerning you, and they will bear you in their hands, so that you do not strike your foot on a stone."}} # [[when]] # [[as soon as]], [[when]] ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|as soon as}} {{l|lb|esoubal}} ---- ==Old English== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|ang|wan}}, {{l|ang|ƿann}}, {{l|ang|wonn}}, {{l|ang|ƿan}}, {{l|ang|ƿonn}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|ang|/wɑnn/}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|enm|gem-pro|*wannaz||dark}}, of {{unk|ang|title=uncertain}} origin. Cognate with {{cog|ofs|wann}}, {{m|ofs|wonn||dark}}. ====Adjective==== {{ang-adj}} # [[dark]] #* ''Beowulf'', ll. 702-3: #*: {{quote|ang|Com on '''wanre''' niht / scriðan sceadugenga.|The shadow-walker came slithering from the dark night.}} =====Declension===== {{ang-adjdec-long|wann}} =====Descendants===== * {{desctree|enm|wan}} ===Etymology 2=== Inflected forms. ====Verb==== {{ang-verb-form}} # {{inflection of|ang|winnan||1|s|pret}} # {{inflection of|ang|winnan||3|s|pret}} ---- ==Pennsylvania German== ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|pdc|goh|wanne}}, from {{inh|pdc|gem-pro|*hwannē}}.
